products.name: Abies alba
products.description: Abies alba is a large evergreen coniferous tree growing to 40–50 m

products.name: Abies amabilis
products.description: The tree is a large evergreen conifer growing to 30–45 metres (98–148 feet)

products.name: Abies balsamea
products.description: Balsam fir is a small to medium-size evergreen tree typically 14–20 metres (46–66 ft) tall

products.name: Abies borisii-regis
products.description: It is a large evergreen coniferous tree growing to 40–50 m

products.name: Abies cephalonica
products.description: They are 2-3 cm long, needle -like, prickly and bright green on the upper face

products.name: Abies concolor
products.description: This large evergreen conifer grows best in the central Sierra Nevada of California

products.name: Abies nordmanniana
products.description: It is a large evergreen coniferous tree growing to 55–61 m tall and with a trunk diameter of up to 2 m

products.name: Abies fabri
products.description: the family Pinaceae. It is endemic to Sichuan in western China

products.name: Abies fargesii
products.description: Its common name is Farges' fir, after the French missionary

products.name: Abies firma
products.description: Abies firma is a medium-sized to large evergreen coniferous tree growing to 50 metres

products.name: Abies forrestii
products.description: This species is variable in morphology, and there are several varieties. Some of these are treated as separate species.[1] In general, it grows up to about 20 meters tall

products.name: Fraser fir
products.description: Abies fraseri is a small evergreen coniferous tree typically growing between 10 and 15 m (30 and 50 ft) tall

products.name: Abies grandis
products.description: Abies grandis is a large evergreen conifer growing to 40–70 metres (130–230 feet) tall, exceptionally 100 m (330 ft)

products.name: Abies holophylla
products.description: Abies holophylla, also called needle fir[2] or Manchurian fir, is a species of fir native to mountainous regions of northern Korea, southern Ussuriland, and China in the provinces of Heilongjiang, Jilin, and Liaoning.

products.name: Abies homolepis
products.description: Abies homolepis, the Nikko fir[2] (in Japanese, urajiro-momi), is a fir native to the mountains of central and southern Honshū and Shikoku, Japan.

products.name: Abies koreana
products.description: It is a small to medium-sized evergreen coniferous tree growing to 10–18 m (33–59 ft) tall with a trunk diameter of up to 0.7 m (2 ft 4 in), smaller and sometimes shrubby at the tree line.

products.name: Abies lasiocarpa
products.description: Abies lasiocarpa is a medium-sized evergreen conifer with a very narrow conic crown, growing to 20 metres (66 ft) tall, exceptionally 40–50 m (130–160 ft)

products.name: Abies magnifica
products.description: Abies magnifica is a large evergreen tree typically up to 40–60 metres (130–200 ft) tall and 2 m (6 ft 7 in) trunk diameter, rarely to 76.5 m (251 ft) tall and 3 m (9 ft 10 in) diameter

products.name: Abies mariesii
products.description: in Japanese,Ōshirabiso, or Aomoritodomatsu) is a fir native to the mountains of central and northern Honshū, Japan

products.name: Abies nebrodensis
products.description: It is a medium-size evergreen coniferous tree growing to 15–25 m tall and with a trunk diameter of up to 1 m.[1]The leaves are needle-like

products.name: Abies nephrolepis
products.description: Abies nephrolepis, commonly known as Khingan fir,[4] is a species of fir native to northeastern China (Hebei, Heilongjiang, Jilin, Liaoning, Shaanxi)

products.name: Abies nordmanniana
products.description: It is a large evergreen coniferous tree growing to 55–61 m tall and with a trunk diameter of up to 2 m. In the Western Caucasus Reserve

products.name: Abies numidica
products.description: Abies numidica is a medium-sized to large evergreen tree growing to 20–35 meters tall, with a trunk up to 1 meter diameter.

products.name: Abies pindrow
products.description: It is a large evergreen tree growing to 40–60 metres (130–200 ft) tall, and with a trunk diameter of up to 2–2.5 metres

products.name: Abies pinsapo
products.description: Abies pinsapo is an evergreen conifer growing to 20–30 m tall, with a conic crown, sometimes becoming irregular with age

products.name: Abies procera
products.description: A. procera is a large evergreen conifer with a narrow conic crown, growing up to 70 meters (230 ft) tall and 2 m (6 ft 7 in) in trunk diameter

products.name: Abies recurvata
products.description: Abies recurvata is a species of conifer in the family Pinaceae. It is found only in China.

products.name: Abies sachalinensis
products.description: Grows to 30m tall with Girths up to 100 cm. The crown pyramidal, but tend to flatten out as they grow to old age.

products.name: Abies sibirica
products.description: The tree lives in the cold boreal climate on moist soils in mountains or river basins at elevations of 1900–2400 m. It is very shade-tolerant

products.name: Abies veitchii
products.description: Abies veitchii var. veitchii. Endemic to Honshū; Shoots densely pubescent. Leaves 1.5–3 cm long; stomatal bands bluish white.

products.name: Abies spectabilis
products.description: Abies spectabilis, the East Himalayan fir, is a conifer species in the family Pinaceae and the genus Abies.

products.name: Abies fargesii
products.description: Abies fargesii Chinese is a species of fir, a coniferous tree in the family Pinaceae

products.name: Acidosasa
products.description: Grow in south coastal China, and have sour shoots.

products.name: Acidosasa chienouensis
products.description: Green glabrous culms, sheath turns brown, from green. The roots are often eaten, and are said to be delicious.

products.name: Acidosasa edulis
products.description: Green glabrous culms, sheath turns brown, from green. The roots are often eaten, and are said to be delicious.

products.name: Actinocladum
products.description: A one-member genus distributed in western South America and Brazil.

products.name: Ampelocalamus
products.description: Hangs loosely, or is scrambling. Nodes are slightly swollen. Nearly equal branches, central branches usually smaller than culms.

products.name: Apoclada
products.description: A one-member genus found in the forests of southeastern Brazil.

products.name: Arthrostylidium
products.description: climbing bamboos found in the New World.

products.name: Bacopa monnieri
products.description: Bacopa monnieri is a non-aromatic herb. The leaves of this plant are succulent, oblong, and 4–6 mm (0.16–0.24 in) thick

products.name: Crassula aquatica
products.description: Crassula aquatica is a small plant forming thin mats or small patches on mud and sand, and growing more erect when exposed to open air for longer periods.

products.name: Cymodocea nodosa
products.description: C. nodosa has light green or greyish-green leaves. They are very narrow but may be up to forty centimetres long.

products.name: Helanthium tenellum
products.description: The leaves of H. tenellum are narrowly elliptical or lanceolate. At different times during the plant's life cycle

products.name: Juncus roemerianus
products.description: This rush is a perennial plant forming tufts of rough, rigid stems and leaves. It is gray-green in color.

products.name: Myriophyllum spicatum
products.description: Eurasian watermilfoil has slender stems up to 250 centimetres (8.2 ft) long.

products.name: Najas marina
products.description: Najas marina is an annual producing a slender, branching stem up to 40 or 45 centimeters in maximum length.

products.name: Sagittaria
products.description: Sagittaria plant stock (the perennial rhizome) is a horizontal creeper (stoloniferous) and obliquely obovate

products.name: Sporobolus alterniflorus
products.description: Sporobolus alterniflorus, or synonymously known as Spartina alterniflora, the smooth cordgrass,[1] saltmarsh cordgrass

products.name: Vallisneria
products.description: Vallisneria (named in honor of Antonio Vallisneri[3][4]) is a genus of freshwater aquatic plant, commonly called eelgrass, tape grass or vallis.

products.name: Zostera marina
products.description: Zostera marina is a flowering vascular plant species as one of many kinds of seagrass,

products.description: Fragrant unisexual shrubs. This genus is the only woody

products.description: Mostly shrubs and trees, usually without hairs or scales.

products.name: Circaeastera
products.description: Herbaceous perennials and annuals

products.name: Eupteleaceae

products.name: Lardizabalaceae
products.description: Woody vines, including climbers, and a few shrubs.

products.name: Menisperma
products.description: Woody vines, along with some shrubs, small trees and herbaceous plants.

products.name: Nelumbonaceae
products.description: Herbaceous aquatic perennials with underground rhizomes that produce tubers.

products.name: Papaveraceae
products.description: Mostly herbaceous annuals and perennials, with a few shrubs and fewer trees

products.name: Ranunculaceae
products.description: Herbaceous plants, woody vines and small shrubs

products.name: Sabiaceae
products.description: Evergreen and deciduous shrubs, trees and woody vines

products.name: Trochodendra­ceae
products.description: Evergreen shrubs and trees with spirally arranged leaves and limited vascular systems

products.name: Najas flexilis
products.description: Najas flexilis is an aquatic annual plant native to parts of North America and Europe. It is native to northern and central Europe from Norway to Ireland to Switzerland

products.name: Najas gracillima
products.description: Najas gracillima,[2][3][4][5] the slender waternymph,[6] is a submerged species of aquatic plant in the Hydrocharitaceae family.

products.name: Amborellaceae
products.description: Just one species, Amborella trichopoda, of evergreen shrubs and trees.

products.name: Annonaceae
products.description: Shrubs, large trees and woody vines with fibrous bark

products.name: Aristolochia ­ceae

products.description: Woody vines with smooth leathery leaves
